abdest0-1: Before wudu, we need to have an intention in our hearts that we are going to make wudu.
abdest0-2: After intention for wudu, it is sunnah to say: BISMILLAH (in the name of Allah).
abdest1-1: When you want to make wudu, you have to make intention in your heart and say BISMILLAH, and then it is sunnah to wash hands 3 times with water: firt wash right hand, then left hand.
abdest1-2: Rinse your mouth (with right hand) at least once, max. 3 times, taking water with right hand.
abdest2-1: Rinse your mouth (with right hand) at least once, max. 3 times, taking water with right hand.
abdest3-1: Rinse your nose (with left hand) at least once, max. 3 times with water.
abdest3-2: While washing nostrils, you sniff the water with right hand, and while blowing out, you use left hand.
abdest4-1: Wash face at least once, max. 3 times, from ear to ear, and from hairline to under the chin.
abdest5-1: Wash arms at least once, max. 3 times, from fingertips to above the elbow. First right, then left arm. Make sure no part is left dry.
abdest6-title: Wiping of the head and ears
abdest6-1: Make masah of the head with wet hands once, from the hearline to the back of the head, and vice versa. Make masah of the ears once, with index fingers clean bends of the ears and with the thumbs the back of the ears.
abdest7-1: Wash feets at least once, max. 3 times, from the top of the toes to above the anckles. First right, then left feet.
abdest7-2: It is sunnah to clean between the toes with pinky finger of the left hand.
abdest8-title: Finish your wudu with the dua
abdest8-0: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ
abdest8-1: ASH-HADU 'AN LAA 'ILAAHA 'ILLALLAAHU WAHDAHU LAA SHAREEKA LAH, WA 'ASH-HADU 'ANNA MUHAMMADAN 'ABDUHU WA RASOOLUH
abdest8-2: I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.
pocetak_namaza: After wudu, stand on a clean place and make intention in your heart to start with specific salah.
pocetni_tekbir: Raise your hands up to your earlobes or shoulders, and say:
vezanje_ruku: Salah starts with opening dua and it is sunnah. Place your right hand over your left, on chest, navel or stomach. One of opening duas on this step is dua:
euza_bismilla_fatiha: Then you recite Auzubillah and Bismillah quietly. Then recite surah Al-Fatiha with tajweed (correct recitation of the Quran)
sunnet_dizanje_ruku_1: Then you say {{zikr}} ({{zikrTr}}) and bow down (go to ruku') during which the worshiper straightens his back and does not throw them out, does not lower his head or straighten up. Place your hands on your knees and spread your fingers.
sunnet_dizanje_ruku_2: Then while you stand up fully straight again, say:
na_rukuu: While on ruku' look at the place of sujood and say 3 times:
padanje_na_sedzdu: After that, go down into prostration (sujood) and say {{zikr}} ({{zikrTr}}) while going down.
na_sedzdi: Place your face between palms of hands (feets are straight and toes are pointing forward) and say 3 times:
tijelo_na_sedzdi: It is necessary to make sujood with 7 part of the body: forehead, nose, palms of both hands, both knees and inner part of toes, spreading your thighs, not leaning stomach on them, with fingers facing Qiblah.
ponovni_odlazak_na_sedzdu: Then make another saying {{zikr}} ({{zikrTr}}) while going to it. At it, as at the previous one, say:
poslije_druge_sedzde: After second sujood, while saying {{zikr}} ({{zikrTr}}) stand up for the next rak'ah.
drugi_rekat: Place again your right hand over your left, and say quietly:
tesehud: Then say {{zikr}} ({{zikrTr}}), sit on your knees, raise your index finger of the right hand, and while looking at it, say:
predavanje_selama: Complete the salah by turning your head over your right shoulder, saying:
predavanje_selama_2: then repeat these words while turning your head over your left shoulder.
namaz_zavrsen: After this, the salah is completed.
skrusenost: You have to humble yourself. To humble yourself is one of the main things in prayer. Allah says in the Quran that believers who are successful are those who humble themselves in prayer
nesto_iz_kurana: After Al-Fatiha recite something from the Quran
ustajanje_sa_sedzde_i_sjedenje: Getting up from sujood and sitting
ustajanje_na_sljedeci_rekat: Standing up for the next reka'ah
tesehud_title: Getting up from sujood and dhikr on tashahud (sitting)
dizanje_ruku: Raising hands same as while first takbeer
sunnet_povratak_sa_rukua_hadis: Allah's Messenger used to raise both his hands up to the level of his shoulders when opening the prayer; and on saying the Takbir for bowing. And on rasinig his head from bowing he used to do the same and then say: "Semi'a l-lahu liman hamidah, Rabbana wa laka l-hamd" and he did not do that in prostration.
sunnet_treci_rekat_hadis: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Umar: I saw that whenever Allah's Messenger stood for the prayer, he used to raise both his hands up to the shoulders, and used to do the same on saying Takbir for bowing and on rising his head from it, and used to say: "Sami'a l-lahu liman hamidah." But he did not do that in prostration.
sunneti_povratak_sa_rukua: Sunnah while going back from ruku'
odlazak_na_sedzdu_prvo_rukama: It is sunnah, while going to sujood, to first place hands, and then knees.
sunnet_kaziprst: The Messenger of Allah, sallallaahu 'alayhi wa sallam, would connect the tip of his thumb with the tip of his middle finger by making a link and would point his index finger in the direction of the qibla and his gaze would be directed at him.
sunnet_prvo_sjedenje: It is Sunnah to sit on one's feet in the first sitting and between two prostrations, to straighten the right leg and bend the toes so that they are facing the Qibla, and to bend the left leg and sit on it, or to sit on the ends of the straightened feet
sunnet_zikr_na_sjedenju_title: After saying 'RABIG-FIR-LĪ, RABIG-FIR-LĪ' it is sunnah to say this dhikr:
sunnet_zikr_na_sjedenju_wxyz: ALLAHUMMAGHFIRLI, WARHAMNI, WAHDINI, WAJBURNI, WA'AAFINI, WARZUQNI, WARFA'NI.
sunnet_zikr_na_sjedenju: ٱللّهُمَّ ٱغْفِرْ لِي وَٱرْحَمْنِي وَٱهْدِنِي وَٱجْبُرْنِي وَعَافِنِي وَٱرْزُقْنِي وَٱرْفَعْنِي
sunnet_zikr_na_sjedenju_tr: O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, strenghten and enrich me, grant me healt and protection, provide me with sustenance and raise my rank
postavljanje_sutre: Sutrah is an object used as a barrier between himslef and one passing in front of him. It can be a chair, wall, pillar, or even the back of the man who is praying in front of us.
sunneti_na_sjedenju_izmedju_sedzdi: Sunnah while sitting between two sujoods
predaja_selama_sunnet_1_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA ANTAS-SALAM WA MINKAS-SALAM, TABARAKTA YA DHAL-JALALI WAL-IKRAM
predaja_selama_sunnet_1: ٱللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ ٱلسَّلَامُ وَمِنْكَ ٱلسَّلَام تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا ٱلْجَلَالِ وَٱلْإِكْرَام
predaja_selama_sunnet_1_tr: O Allah, You are peace, from You is all peace, blessed are You, O Possessor of majesty and honour
predaja_selama_sunnet_2_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA AI'NNI ALA ZIKRIKA, WA SHUKRIKA, WA HUSNI 'IBAADATIK
predaja_selama_sunnet_2: ٱللِّهُمَّ أَعِنِّي عَلَىٰ ذِكْرِكَ وَشُكْرِكَ وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
predaja_selama_sunnet_2_tr: O Allah, help me remember You, to be grateful to You, and to worship You in an excellent manner
pocetna_dova_sunnet_title: Other opening duas you can recite
pocetna_dova_1: ٱللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيرًا وَٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيرًا وَسُبْحَانَ ٱللَّهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
pocetna_dova_1_wxyz: ALLAHU AKBARU KABIRA, WAL-HAMDU LILLAHI KATHIRA, SUBHANALLAHI BUKRATAN WA-ASEELA
pocetna_dova_1_tr: Allah is Most Great and much praise be to Allah and glorified be Allah at the beginning and end of the day
sunnet_zikr_rukuu_sedzda_1_wxyz: SUBHANAK-ALLAHUMMA, RABBANA WA BIHAMDIKA, ALLAHUM-MAGHFIR LI
sunnet_zikr_rukuu_sedzda_1: سُبْحَانَ ٱللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ , ٱللَّهُمَّ ٱغْفِرْ لِي
sunnet_zikr_rukuu_sedzda_1_tr: Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me
sunnet_zikr_rukuu_sedzda_2_tr: You are the Most Glorious, the Most Holy, the Lord of the angels and Jibril
semiallahu_limen_hamideh_tr: Allah heard the one who praised Him
esselamu_alejkum_ve_rahmetullah_tr: May peace and the mercy of Allah be upon you
ettehijjatu_2: ٱلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ ٱللَّهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ
ettehijjatu_2_wxyz: AS-SALAAMU 'ALAYKA AYYUHAN-NABIYYU WA RAHMETULLAHI WA BARAKAATU.
ettehijjatu_3: ٱلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَىٰ عِبَادِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلصَّالِحِين
ettehijjatu_3_wxyz: AS-SALAAMU ALAYNA, WA ALAA IBAADI-LLAHIS SAALIHEEN.
ettehijjatu_4: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّه
ettehijjatu_5_wxyz: WA ASHHADU ANNA MUHAMMADAN ABDUHU WA RASOOLUH
ettehijjatu_1_tr: All compliments are for Allah, and prayers and good deeds.
ettehijjatu_2_tr: Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings.
ettehijjatu_3_tr: Peace be upon us and on the righteous servants of Allah.
ettehijjatu_4_tr: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah
ettehijjatu_5_tr: and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and messenger.
salavati_1: ٱللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَىٰ مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَىٰ آلِ مُحَمَّد
salavati_1_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA SALLI 'ALAA MUHAMMADIN WA 'ALAA AALI MUHAMMED
salavati_2: كَمَا صَلَّيْتَ عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَعَلَىٰ آلِ إبْرَاهِيمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيد
salavati_2_wxyz: KAMAA SALLAYTA 'ALAA IBRAHEEMA WE 'ALAA AALI IBRAHEEM, INNAKA HAMEEDUM MAJEED.
salavati_3: ٱللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ عَلَىٰ مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلَىٰ آلِ مُحَمَّد
salavati_3_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA BAARIK 'ALAA MUHAMMADIN WA 'ALAA AALI MUHAMMED
salavati_4: كَمَا بَارَكْتَ عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَعَلَىٰ آلِ إبْرَاهِيمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيدٌ مَجِيد
salavati_4_wxyz: KAMAA BAARAKTA 'ALAA IBRAHEEMA WA 'ALAA AALI IBRAHEEMA, INNAKA HAMEEDUM MAJEED.
salavati_1_tr: O Allah, send Your mercy upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad
salavati_2_tr: just as You sent mercy upon Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim. Truly You are Praiseworthy and Glorious.
salavati_3_tr: O Allah, send blessings upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad
salavati_4_tr: just as You sent blessings upon Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim. Truly You are Praiseworthy and Glorious.
allahumme_rabbena_1: رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِي ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي لْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّار
allahumme_rabbena_1_wxyz: ALLAHUMME RABBANA AATINA FID-DUNYA HASANATAN WA FIL-AAKHIRATI HASANATAN WA QINA ‘ADHAABAN NAAR.
allahumme_rabbena_3_wxyz: WA LIL MU'MININA YAUMA YAQUMUL HISAB.
allahumme_rabbena_1_tr: O our Lord, give us good in this world and the good in the hereafter and protect us from the punishemnt of the Fire.
allahumme_rabbena_2_tr: Our Lord, forgive me, my parents
allahumme_rabbena_3_tr: and the believers on the Day of Judgement.
rabigfirli: رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِي رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِي
rabigfirli_tr: O my Lord, forgive me, O my Lord, forgive me
zikr_na_povratku_sa_rukua: After you are standing upright, and before going to sujood, say:
rabbena_lekel_hamd_tr: Our Lord, to You is all praise
subhane_rabijel_eala_tr: Glory be to my Lord, the Highest
subhane_rabijel_azim_tr: Glory be to my Lord, the Great
subhaneke_1_tr: O Allah, glory and praise are for You.
subhaneke_4_tr: and there is no god but You.
euza_tr: I seek protection in Allah from the rejected Satan
bismillah_tr: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful
fatiha_1_tr: Praise be to Allah, Lord of all the worlds;
fatiha_2_tr: The Most Gracious, the Most Merciful;
fatiha_3_tr: Master of the Day of Recompense (Judgement day);
fatiha_4_tr: You alone we worship, and You alone we ask for help;
fatiha_5_tr: Guide us on the straight path;
fatiha_6_tr: the path of those who You have bestowed favors;
fatiha_7_tr: not of those who have evoked Your anger or those who are astray.
ihlas_3_tr: He neither begets nor is born,
ihlas_4_tr: Nor is there to Him any equivalent!"
kevser_1_tr: Indeed, We have granted you abundant goodness,
kevser_2_tr: so pray and sacrifice to your Lord alone,
kevser_3_tr: indeed, only the one who hates you is truly cut off from any goodness.
for_more_info: All your questions, advices, critics you can send on our facebook page or through e-mail adress:
author: Author
audio: Audio dhikret dhe duat nga namazi
vaktija_obavestenje: Attention: Prayer times are available only for some Bosnian, Serbian, and Montenegrian cities
moreApps: Take a look on other apps of the same author
sunnet_ruku_zikr_1_wxyz: RABBANA WA LAKAL-HAMDU HAMDAN KATHIRAN TAYYIBAN MUBARAKAN FIHI.
sunnet_ruku_zikr_1_tr: Our Lord, to You be praise - infinite praise, beautiful praise in which (for us) every blessing is.
sunnet_ruku_zikr_1: رَبَّنـا وَلَكَ الحَمْـدُ حَمْـداً كَثـيراً طَيِّـباً مُـبارَكاً فيه
compass_error: To use the compass, you must give the app permission to use your location. Close the app, then open it, and try again
support_mnamaz_app: Support the app that helps thousands of people daily to learn prayer
donate_1: The "mNamaz" app has already helped thousands of people worldwide learn how to pray correctly. With over 400,000 downloads, we have become one of the leading apps for learning prayer.
donate_2: Our goal is simple but important - to help every Muslim, regardless of location, learn how to pray correctly. The app is free, ad-free, and available in multiple languages.
donate_3: To continue growing and helping more people, we need your support. Every donation helps us to:
donate_3_1: - Translate the app into new languages
donate_4: Support the spread of knowledge about prayer and be part of this beneficial project. Your donation, regardless of amount, is a continuous charity that will continue to bring rewards as long as people use the app to learn prayer.
donate_warning: IMPORTANT: We only accept donations through official channels - through the app or the website mnamaz.com
lekcija_1_2: There are 5 prayers during one day and it is obligatory for every Muslim.
lekcija_1_2_1: It is the way of worshipping Allah and maintaining spiritual connection with Him.
lekcija_1_2_2: Each prayer consists of a specific number of rakats (prayer cycles).
lekcija_1_2_2_1: A rakat is one complete unit consisting of standing (qiyam), bowing (ruku'), prostration (sujood) and sitting. Each prayer has a prescribed number of rakats that must be performed.
lekcija_1_2_3: Each rakat contains standing, bowing (ruku), prostration (sujood), and sitting.
lekcija_1_2_4: During prayer, verses from the Quran and various supplications are recited in Arabic.
lekcija_1_3_2: - It helps develop discipline and self-control.
lekcija_1_3_3: - It strengthens the connection with Allah through regular remembrance of Him.
lekcija_1_3_4: - It teaches us humility and submission.
lekcija_1_3_6: - It provides spiritual peace and tranquility.
lekcija_2_2: These are the prayers: Fajr (morning prayer), Dhuhr (noon prayer), Asr (afternoon prayer), Maghrib (sunset prayer) and Isha (night prayer).
lekcija_2_2_1: 1. Fajr Prayer. The time for Fajr prayer begins from dawn (appearance of first light on horizon) and lasts until sunrise. It is determined when the first light of dawn appears on the eastern horizon.
lekcija_2_2_2: 2. Dhuhr Prayer. The time for Dhuhr prayer begins when the sun passes its zenith (highest point) and lasts until an object's shadow becomes equal to its length (plus the length of noon shadow). It is determined when the sun begins to descend from its highest point.
lekcija_2_2_3: 3. Asr Prayer. The time for Asr prayer begins when an object's shadow becomes equal to its length (plus the length of noon shadow) and lasts until sunset. It is determined by measuring the shadow of an object.
lekcija_2_2_4: 4. Maghrib Prayer. The time for Maghrib prayer begins immediately after sunset and lasts until the disappearance of evening twilight. It is determined when the sun completely sets below the horizon.
lekcija_2_2_5: 5. Isha Prayer. The time for Isha prayer begins when the evening twilight disappears and lasts until dawn. It is determined when the evening twilight completely disappears from the western horizon.
lekcija_2_2_6: Note: For accurate tracking of prayer times, it's best to follow the prayer timetable used by the local Islamic community. Prayer times are adjusted to geographical location and season, ensuring accurate times for prayer in your area.
lekcija_3_2: Before prayer, the body, clothes, and place of prayer must be clean. This means we need to perform ablution (wudu - washing of specific body parts) before each prayer, and sometimes a full body wash (ghusl) is required. Also, the clothes we wear and the place where we pray must be free from impurities.
lekcija_3_3_3: - Deep sleep or loss of consciousness
lekcija_3_3_4: - Touching private parts directly with hand
lekcija_3_4: When a person becomes in state of major impurity and needs to perform ghusl:
lekcija_3_4_2: - After ejaculation in wakeful state or sleep
lekcija_3_4_pojasnjenje: Note: In the first two cases (after intimate relations and ejaculation), the person must bathe before praying. In the other two cases (hayd and nifas), the woman will bathe after the end of menstruation or postnatal bleeding. During menstruation and postnatal bleeding, a woman is not obligated and cannot pray, and will not make up the missed prayers from this period.
lekcija_3_5: How to perform ghusl according to sunnah:
lekcija_3_5_1: 1. Make intention for ghusl (intend in heart to begin the ritual bath).
lekcija_3_5_3: 3. Wash private parts and surrounding area.
lekcija_3_5_5: 5. Pour water over head three times.
lekcija_3_5_6: 6. Pour water over right then left side of body.
lekcija_3_5_7: 7. Wash entire body, ensuring water reaches all parts.
lekcija_3_6: Minimum for validity of ghusl is:
lekcija_3_6_2: 2. Wash entire body so water reaches every part, including mouth and nose.
lekcija_4_2: Clothing must be clean and cover the body in the prescribed manner:
lekcija_4_2_1: - For men: covering from navel to below knees (note: shoulders should also be covered as it is disliked to pray with exposed shoulders)
lekcija_4_2_2: - For women: entire body except face and hands
lekcija_5_2: Prayer can be performed anywhere during the prescribed prayer time. This can be at work, while traveling, or at home. Men are recommended to pray in the mosque together with others whenever possible (the reward for prayer performed in congregation is 27 times greater than prayer performed alone), while women are allowed to pray in the mosque but it is preferable for them to pray at home.
lekcija_6_2: Intention (Niyyah): Before beginning prayer, one must make intention in the heart for the specific prayer.
lekcija_6_3: Ablution: Before prayer, if we don't have ablution, we need to perform it. This includes washing hands, mouth, nose, face, arms up to the elbows, wiping the head, washing ears and feet up to the ankles.
lekcija_6_4: Qibla: During prayer, we must face the Qibla, which is in the direction of the Kaaba in Mecca.
lekcija_6_5: Calmness and Focus: Before entering prayer, it's important to calm down, direct thoughts to the worship of Allah, and remove anything that might disturb our concentration.
lekcija_7_2: Beginners should learn the meanings of dhikr and surahs recited in prayer to enjoy prayer more.
lekcija_7_3: Learning Arabic script is important to read dhikr and surahs correctly, as it's impossible to accurately represent the pronunciation of dhikr and surahs in our language.
lekcija_7_4: If you want to learn Arabic script, look for a Quran school near you or you can use the 'mSufara' app which you can download from Google Play or App Store, or at the link below:
lekcija_9_2: Prayer in congregation is recommended for men, and women are also allowed to pray in congregation in the mosque.
lekcija_9_4_1: - Men should regularly pray in congregation at the mosque whenever possible.
lekcija_9_4_2: - The rows should be straight and tight, without gaps. Rows are filled from the middle towards the right and left sides.
lekcija_9_4_3: - The first rows are best for men.
lekcija_9_8_1: - Women can pray in the mosque, but are also allowed to pray at home.
lekcija_9_8_2: - When praying in the mosque, women form rows behind men.
lekcija_9_8_3: - For women, the last rows are best.
lekcija_9_12_1: - Congregation is formed with minimum two believers - imam and one follower.
lekcija_9_12_2: - Followers must follow imam in all prayer actions. When imam recites aloud (in Fajr, Maghrib and Isha), followers listen to his recitation, and when imam recites quietly to himself (in Dhuhr and Asr), followers also recite quietly to themselves.
lekcija_9_15_1: - If you're late to prayer and find the imam in prayer, join immediately in whatever position the imam is in. The rakat you join counts as your first rakat.
lekcija_9_15_1_napomena: Note: You are considered to have caught a rak'ah if you joined at the latest during ruku' (bowing). If you did not catch the ruku', that rakat is counted as missed and you must make it up.
lekcija_9_15_2: - After the imam gives salam, you don't give salam, but stand up and make up missed rakats.
lekcija_9_15_3: - Pray missed rakats in order as you would have prayed if you were there from beginning. For example, if you joined in the third rakat, that counts as your first rakat.
lekcija_9_16: Example: If you missed 2 rakats of Dhuhr prayer:
lekcija_9_16_1: 1. Join imam whenever you find him
lekcija_9_16_2: 2. After imam's salam, stand up and pray remaining 2 rakats
lekcija_9_16_3: 3. Finish prayer normally with sitting and salam
intro-description: The most important things to know before prayer
lekcija_8_2: Adhan is the call to prayer that is recited from mosques before each of the five daily prayers. It informs Muslims about the beginning of prayer time and calls them to pray together in congregation. If someone wants to pray alone at home or elsewhere, it's not obligatory to recite adhan before prayer, but it is recommended.
lekcija_8_3: The Adhan consists of the following words:
lekcija_8_4: اَللهُ أَكْبَرُ اَللهُ أَكْبَرُ اَللهُ أَكْبَرُ اَللهُ أَكْبَرُ
lekcija_8_4_wxyz: ALLAHU AKBAR, ALLAHU AKBAR, ALLAHU AKBAR, ALLAHU AKBAR
lekcija_8_4_tr: Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest
lekcija_8_5: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ
lekcija_8_5_wxyz: ASH-HADU AN LA ILAHA ILLALLAH, ASH-HADU AN LA ILAHA ILLALLAH
lekcija_8_5_tr: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, I bear witness that there is no god but Allah
lekcija_8_6: أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللهِ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللهِ
lekcija_8_6_wxyz: ASH-HADU ANNA MUHAMMADAN RASULULLAH, ASH-HADU ANNA MUHAMMADAN RASULULLAH
lekcija_8_6_tr: I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah
lekcija_8_7: حَيَّ عَلَى الصَّلاَةِ حَيَّ عَلَى الصَّلاَةِ
lekcija_8_7_tr: Come to prayer, Come to prayer
lekcija_8_8: حَيَّ عَلَى الْفَلاَحِ حَيَّ عَلَى الْفَلاَحِ
lekcija_8_8_tr: Come to success, Come to success
lekcija_8_9_tr: Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest
lekcija_8_10_tr: There is no god but Allah
lekcija_8_12: اَلصَّلاَةُ خَيْرٌ مِنَ النَّوْمِ اَلصَّلاَةُ خَيْرٌ مِنَ النَّوْمِ
lekcija_8_12_wxyz: AS-SALATU KHAYRUN MINAN-NAWM, AS-SALATU KHAYRUN MINAN-NAWM
lekcija_8_12_tr: Prayer is better than sleep, Prayer is better than sleep
lekcija_8_14: قَدْ قَامَتِ الصَّلاَةُ قَدْ قَامَتِ الصَّلاَةُ
lekcija_8_14_tr: Prayer has begun, Prayer has begun
lekcija_8_16: لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللهِ
lekcija_8_16_wxyz: LA HAWLA WA LA QUWWATA ILLA BILLAH
lekcija_8_16_tr: There is no power nor might except with Allah
lekcija_8_18: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ هَذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيلَةَ وَالْفَضِيلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَحْمُودًا الَّذِي وَعَدْتَهُ
lekcija_8_18_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA RABBA HADHIHID-DA'WATIT-TAMMAH, WAS-SALATIL-QA'IMAH, ATI MUHAMMAADANIL-WASILATA WAL-FADILAH, WAB'ATHHU MAQAMAM-MAHMUDAN-ALLADHI WA'ADTAH
lekcija_8_18_tr: O Allah, Lord of this perfect call and the prayer to be offered, grant Muhammad the station of Al-Wasilah and honor, and raise him to the praiseworthy position that You have promised him
lekcija_8_11: In the Fajr adhan, after the words 'Hayya 'alal-falah', these words are added:
lekcija_8_13_1: Iqamah is the second call that is recited immediately before beginning the obligatory prayer. The text is the same as in adhan, except there is an addition after 'Hayya alal-falah' which states:
lekcija_8_13_2_tr: Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest
lekcija_8_13_3: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ
lekcija_8_13_3_tr: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah
lekcija_8_13_4_tr: I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah
lekcija_8_13_7: قَدْ قَامَتِ الصَّلاَةُ قَدْ قَامَتِ الصَّلاَةُ
lekcija_8_13_7_tr: Prayer has begun, Prayer has begun
lekcija_8_13_8_tr: Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest
lekcija_8_13_9_tr: There is no god but Allah
lekcija_8_15: It is Sunnah (recommended) for the one who hears the adhan to repeat the words after the muezzin, except when the muezzin says 'Hayya alas-salah' and 'Hayya alal-falah', then one responds with:
lekcija_8_15_1: Note: Women are not obligated to recite either adhan or iqamah, whether praying alone or in a group, but when they hear the adhan, they may repeat its words.
lekcija_8_17: After the adhan, it is recommended to recite this supplication:
zikr-posle-namaza-description: Prescribed dhikrs and supplications after prayer
zikr-posle-namaza-1: Dhikrs recited after prayer are sunnah (recommended acts) and are not obligatory
zikr_posle_namaza_1: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ, أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ, أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ
zikr_posle_namaza_1_tr: I ask Allah for forgiveness, I ask Allah for forgiveness, I ask Allah for forgiveness
zikr_posle_namaza_2: اَللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلَامُ, وَمِنْكَ السَّلَامُ, تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
zikr_posle_namaza_2_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA ANTAS-SALAAM WA MINKAS-SALAAM, TABARAKTA YA DHAL-JALAALI WAL-IKRAAM
zikr_posle_namaza_2_tr: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Owner of majesty and honor
zikr_posle_namaza_5_2_tr: All praise is due to Allah (33x)
zikr_posle_namaza_6: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ, لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
zikr_posle_namaza_6_wxyz: LAA ILAAHA ILLALLAHU WAHDAHU LAA SHAREEKA LAH, LAHUL-MULKU WA LAHUL-HAMDU WA HUWA 'ALAA KULLI SHAY'IN QADEER
zikr_posle_namaza_6_tr: There is no god but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He has power over all things
zikr_posle_namaza_7: اَللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّي عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ وَشُكْرِكَ وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
zikr_posle_namaza_7_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA A'INNEE 'ALAA DHIKRIKA WA SHUKRIKA WA HUSNI 'IBAADATIK
zikr_posle_namaza_7_tr: O Allah, help me to remember You, to thank You, and to worship You in the best way
lekcija_2_2_0: Each prayer has its designated time, and prayer cannot be performed before the start or after the end of its prescribed time.
lekcija_2_2_11: - Using a mobile app for prayer times (Prayer Times)
abdest_traje: Ablution remains valid until it is invalidated by one of the mentioned reasons
lekcija_6_6: Cleanliness: Body, clothes, and place of prayer must be free from impurities.
ajetul_kursijj: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْحَىُّ ٱلْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُۥ سِنَةٌۭ وَلَا نَوْمٌۭ ۚ لَّهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ مَن ذَا ٱلَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍۢ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَـُٔودُهُۥ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْعَظِيمُ ٢٥٥
ajetul_kursijj_wxyz: ALLAHU LA ILAHA ILLA HUWAL-HAYYUL-QAYYUM, LA TA'KHUDHUHU SINATUN WA LA NAWM, LAHU MA FIS-SAMAWATI WA MA FIL-ARD, MAN DHAL-LADHI YASHFA'U 'INDAHU ILLA BI-IDHNIH, YA'LAMU MA BAYNA AYDIHIM WA MA KHALFAHUM WA LA YUHITUNA BI-SHAY'IN MIN 'ILMIHI ILLA BIMA SHA', WASI'A KURSIYYUHUS-SAMAWATI WAL-ARD, WA LA YA'UDUHU HIFDHUHUMAA WA HUWAL-'ALIYYUL-'ADHIM
ajetul_kursijj_tr: Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Ever-Living, All-Sustaining. Neither drowsiness nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who could possibly intercede with Him without His permission? He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them, but no one can grasp any of His knowledge—except what He wills ˹to reveal˺. His Seat encompasses the heavens and the earth, and the preservation of both does not tire Him. For He is the Most High, the Greatest.
welcome_description: We are happy that you have decided to learn Islam
welcome_description_2: We will, step by step, learn how to perform prayer correctly
not-mandatory-namaz-description: Eid prayer, Istikharah prayer, Funeral prayer
all_namaz_duas: All dhikrs and supplications in prayer
all_namaz_duas_description: All audio recordings and texts of dhikrs and supplications in prayer in one place
bajram_namaz_dzematski_title: Standing in congregation for Eid prayer
bajram_namaz_takbiri_posle_subhaneke: 3 additional takbirs in the first rakat come after the supplication 'Subhanaka', before Al-Fatiha.
bajram_namaz_hutba_nakon_klanjanja: Unlike Jummah prayer, the Eid sermon is delivered after performing the Eid prayer.
bajram_namaz_hutba_sunnet: The Eid sermon is sunnah and it is recommended to attend and listen to it.
bajram_namaz_hutba_cutanje: During the sermon, one should listen carefully and not talk, as this is a time for religious guidance and advice.
bajram_namaz_cestitanje_posle: After the Eid sermon, Muslims exchange congratulations with each other.
bajram_namaz_cestitke_primjeri: The most common congratulations are: 'Eid Mubarak' or 'Taqabbalallahu minna wa minkum'.
bajram_namaz_sedam_dodatnih_takbira: After the supplication 'Subhanaka', 3 additional takbirs are recited, following the imam
bajram_namaz_pet_dodatnih_takbira: After reciting the surah, before going to ruku' (bowing), 3 additional takbirs are recited.
bajram_namaz_takbir_objasnjenje: After each takbir, hands are raised to the ears or shoulders, then lowered.
bajram_namaz_sedam_puta_napomena: If you forget any of the takbirs, the prayer is still valid and does not need to be repeated.
bajram_namaz_pet_puta_napomena: The number of takbirs is sunnah, and if you make a mistake or forget them, your prayer remains valid.
bajram_namaz_hutba_posle: After completing the Eid prayer, the imam delivers the Eid sermon which the attending Muslims listen to in silence and attention.
istihara_namaz_description: Istikharah prayer is a prayer performed when we want guidance from Allah about something
istihara_namaz_obavijest_1: Istikharah prayer is performed like any other prayer of two rakats.
istihara_namaz_obavijest_2: After giving the salam, the Istikharah supplication is recited.
istihara_namaz_obavijest_3: The supplication can be studied in Arabic as it was transmitted in the hadith, or in translation, or in your own words.
istihara_namaz_obavijest_4: After the prayer and supplication, a decision should be made about the matter for which we performed Istikharah prayer.
istihara_dova: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْتَخِيرُكَ بِعِلْمِكَ وَأَسْتَقْدِرُكَ بِقُدْرَتِكَ وَأَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ الْعَظِيمِ فَإِنَّكَ تَقْدِرُ وَلَا أَقْدِرُ وَتَعْلَمُ وَلَا أَعْلَمُ وَأَنْتَ عَلَّامُ الْغُيُوبِ اللَّهُمَّ إِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الْأَمْرَ خَيْرٌ لِي فِي دِينِي وَمَعَاشِي وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِي - أَوْ قَالَ: فِي عَاجِلِ أَمْرِي وَآجِلِهِ - فَاقْدُرْهُ لِي وَيَسِّرْهُ لِي ثُمَّ بَارِكْ لِي فِيهِ وَإِنْ كُنْتَ تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ هَذَا الْأَمْرَ شَرٌّ لِي فِي دِينِي وَمَعَاشِي وَعَاقِبَةِ أَمْرِي - أَوْ قَالَ: فِي عَاجِلِ أَمْرِي وَآجِلِهِ - فَاصْرِفْهُ عَنِّي وَاصْرِفْنِي عَنْهُ وَاقْدُرْ لِي الْخَيْرَ حَيْثُ كَانَ ثُمَّ أَرْضِنِي بِهِ
istihara_dova_wxyz: ALLAHUMMA INNI ASTAKHIRUKA BI ILMIKA WA ASTAQDIRIKA BI QUDRATIKA WA AS'ALUKA MIN FADLIKA AL-AZIM, FA INNAKA TAQDIRU WA LA AQDIRU WA TA'LAMU WA LA A'LAMU WA ANTA ALLAM AL-GHUYUB. ALLAHUMMA IN KUNTA TA'LAMU ANNA HADHA AL-AMRA KHAYRUN LI FI DINI WA MA'ASHI WA AQIBATI AMRI - AW QALA: FI AJILI AMRI WA AJILIHI - FAQDIRHU LI WA YASSIRHU LI THUMMA BARIK LI FIHI, WA IN KUNTA TA'LAMU ANNA HADHA AL-AMRA SHARRUN LI FI DINI WA MA'ASHI WA AQIBATI AMRI - AW QALA: FI AJILI AMRI WA AJILIHI - FASRIFHU ANNI WASRIFNI ANHU WAQDIR LI AL-KHAYR HAYTHU KANA THUMMA ARDINI BIHI
istihara_dova_tr: O Allah, I seek Your guidance through Your knowledge, and I seek Your empowerment through Your power, and I ask You from Your great bounty. For You have power and I am powerless, You have knowledge and I am ignorant, and You are the Knower of the unseen. O Allah, if You know that this matter is good for me in my religion, my livelihood, and the outcome of my affairs - or he said: in my immediate and future affairs - then decree it for me and facilitate it for me, then bless me in it. And if You know that this matter is bad for me in my religion, my livelihood, and the outcome of my affairs - or he said: in my immediate and future affairs - then turn it away from me and turn me away from it, and decree for me what is good wherever it may be, then make me satisfied with it
istihara_namaz_detaljno_objasnjenje_1: For everything important that a person intends to do or leave, from what is permissible to do or not do (and not what is forbidden or commanded), it is sunnah to perform istikharah prayer as a voluntary prayer which has two rakats and is performed at any time of day or night, and after performing those two rakats of voluntary prayer, the special istikharah supplication is recited.
istihara_namaz_detaljno_objasnjenje_2: By performing istikharah, a person asks Allah to decree, facilitate and bless what he has decided to do if there is good in it for him, his religion and life and has good consequences in both worlds, and if there is harm in what he has decided to do for his religion and life, and has bad consequences in both worlds, he asks Allah to turn it away from him and turn him away from that intention.
istihara_namaz_detaljno_objasnjenje_3: Also, after performing istikharah, it is not reported that one should dream something about that matter where he will be informed in dreams what to do, nor should he expect to receive some special inspiration within himself by which he will be guided how and what to do.
istihara_namaz_detaljno_objasnjenje_4: It is a wrong understanding that istikharah is performed when a person is in doubt and dilemma about what to do, this or that, because in the hadith it says 'When any of you intends to do some (important) matter', which means he has already decided what he wants but doesn't know if there is good for him in what he wants to do, so he performs istikharah for that.
bajram_namaz_bez_ezana: No adhan or iqamah - there is no call to prayer for Eid prayer.
bajram_namaz_tahijjatul_mesdzid: It is recommended to perform 2 rakats of voluntary prayer when entering the mosque.
bajram_namaz_takbir_na_putu: It is sunnah to recite takbirs aloud on the way to the mosque/musalla, especially for Eid al-Adha.
bajram_namaz_kupanje: Ghusl (ritual bath) is recommended before going to prayer.
bajram_namaz_najlepsa_odjeca: Wear your best clothes - this is sunnah.
bajram_namaz_opis: Eid prayer is a special prayer that Muslims perform twice a year:
bajram_namaz_opis_1: - Eid al-Fitr: after the month of fasting (Ramadan).
bajram_namaz_opis_2: - Eid al-Adha: the tenth day of the month of Dhul-Hijjah, on the day of performing Hajj and offering sacrifice.
bajram_namaz_vrijeme_1: - It is performed in the morning, not immediately after sunrise, but approximately 15-20 minutes after sunrise, and can be performed later than that.
bajram_namaz_mjesto_1: - It is performed in the mosque or at a musalla (open space designated for prayer).
bajram_namaz_priprema_1: - No adhan or iqamah - there is no call to prayer for Eid prayer.
bajram_namaz_priprema_2: - It is recommended to perform 2 rakats of voluntary prayer when entering the mosque.
bajram_namaz_priprema_3: - It is sunnah to recite takbirs aloud on the way to the mosque/musalla, especially for Eid al-Adha.
bajram_namaz_priprema_4: - Ghusl (ritual bath) is recommended before going to prayer.
bajram_namaz_priprema_5: - Wear your best clothes - this is sunnah.
bajram_namaz_priprema_6: - For Eid al-Fitr, it is recommended to eat something before prayer, and for Eid al-Adha, it is recommended to postpone eating until after prayer and sacrificing the animal.
bajram_namaz_dzematski_1: - Eid prayer is performed in congregation in the mosque or at a musalla.
bajram_namaz_dzematski_2: - Men form rows behind the imam, and women behind the men.
bajram_namaz_dzematski_3: - The imam leads the prayer and recites all dhikrs and surahs aloud.
bajram_namaz_dzematski_4: - The worshippers follow the imam in all prayer actions.
pocetak_bajram_namaza: Like other prayers, worshippers must come to the mosque with ablution (or perform it in the mosque) and pray the Eid prayer. They will stand in congregation, make intention in their heart to perform Eid prayer and wait for the imam to say the opening takbir and they will perform the rest of the prayer following the imam.
slijedeci_imama_ponavljamo_za_njim: Following the imam, after he says the opening takbir, we raise our hands to our ears or shoulders and say:
uci_imam_mi_slusamo: The imam recites aloud, we listen.
uci_svako_za_sebe_tiho: Each person recites quietly to themselves.
dizanje_sa_sedzde: Then we say {{zikr}} ({{zikrTr}}) while rising from prostration to sitting position, and looking ahead we quietly say:
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka: Funeral prayer is performed for a Muslim who has died. The prayer is performed in congregation and consists of four takbirs.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_1: Funeral prayer is a special prayer performed for a Muslim who has died. This is the only prayer performed in standing position, without ruku and sujud.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_2: The prayer is performed in congregation and consists of four takbirs. After each takbir, specific supplications are recited.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_3: Before starting the prayer, the deceased is placed in front of the imam, and the worshippers line up in rows behind the imam.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_4: For funeral prayer, like any other prayer, ablution is required.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_5: Funeral prayer is fard kifayah, meaning if a sufficient number of Muslims perform it, others are relieved of the obligation.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_7: Funeral prayer can be performed in the mosque or outside the mosque.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_8: For funeral prayer, adhan and iqamah are not required.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_9: Funeral prayer is performed for every Muslim, regardless of age, gender, or social status.
dzenaza_namaz_prije_pocetka_10: After funeral prayer, the deceased is buried according to Islamic rulings.
dzenaza_namaz_pocetna_dova_1: After the first takbir, each person quietly recites the opening supplication Subhanaka.
dzenaza_namaz_prvi_tekbir: The imam says takbir aloud, and the worshippers repeat it after him.
dzenaza_namaz_prvi_tekbir_1: The imam raises his hands to his ears or shoulders and says takbir 'Allahu akbar'.
dzenaza_namaz_prvi_tekbir_2: The worshippers raise their hands to their ears or shoulders and repeat the takbir after the imam.
dzenaza_namaz_prvi_tekbir_3: After the takbir, hands are lowered and folded below the navel, right over left.
dzenaza_namaz_prvi_tekbir_4: Then Subhanaka is recited, which is the same as in other prayers.
dzenaza_namaz_prvi_tekbir_5: Unlike other prayers, in funeral prayer there is no ruku or sujud.
dzenaza_namaz_drugi_tekbir_1: After the second takbir, blessings upon the Prophet are recited.
dzenaza_namaz_cetvrti_tekbir: After the fourth takbir, salam is given.
dzenaza_namaz_dova_za_pokojnika: اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْهُ وَعَافِهِ وَاعْفُ عَنْهُ وَأَكْرِمْ نُزُلَهُ وَوَسِّعْ مَدْخَلَهُ وَاغْسِلْهُ بِالْمَاءِ وَالثَّلْجِ وَالْبَرَدِ وَنَقِّهِ مِنَ الْخَطَايَا كَمَا نَقَّيْتَ الثَّوْبَ الْأَبْيَضَ مِنَ الدَّنَسِ وَأَبْدِلْهُ دَارًا خَيْرًا مِنْ دَارِهِ وَأَهْلًا خَيْرًا مِنْ أَهْلِهِ وَزَوْجًا خَيْرًا مِنْ زَوْجِهِ وَأَدْخِلْهُ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعِذْهُ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ وَعَذَابِ النَّارِ
dzenaza_namaz_dova_za_pokojnika_wxyz: ALLAHUMMAGHFIR LAHU WARHAMHU WA AFIHI WA'FU ANHU WA AKRIM NUZULAHU WA WASSI' MADKHALAHU WAGHSILHU BIL-MA'I WAS-THALJI WAL-BARADI WA NAQQIHI MINAL-KHATAYA KAMA NAQQAYTA ATH-THAWB AL-ABYAD MINA AD-DANAS WA ABDILHU DARAN KHAYRAN MIN DARIHI WA AHLAN KHAYRAN MIN AHLIHI WA ZAWJAN KHAYRAN MIN ZAWJIHI WA ADKHILHU AL-JANNAH WA A'IDHHU MIN ADHAB AL-QABR WA ADHAB AN-NAR
dzenaza_namaz_dova_za_pokojnika_tr: O Allah, forgive him and have mercy on him, and keep him safe and pardon him, and honor his resting place and widen his grave, and wash him with water, snow and hail, and cleanse him of sins as You cleanse white cloth from dirt, and give him a better home than his home, and better family than his family, and better spouse than his spouse, and admit him to Paradise, and protect him from the punishment of the grave and the punishment of the Fire.
dzenaza_namaz_cetvrti_tekbir_1: After the fourth takbir, following the imam, salam is given by turning the head to the right side.
dzenaza_namaz_treci_tekbir_1: After the third takbir, supplication for the deceased is recited.
qiblacompass_1: Use the qibla compass in the app to determine which direction you should face when starting prayer.
dzenaza_predaja_selama_note: In some practices, salam is given to both the right and then the left side.
